The Monsters and the Critics, and Other Essays

wikitext.*:
'''''gar''''' is a [[Noldorin]] word of uncertain meaning.

The word appears in two places:

#in a phrase on a draft of [[Thrór's Map]]: "''[[Lheben]] [[tâl|teil]] [[brand (word)#Noldorin|brann]] [[i]] [[annon]] [[ar]] [[nêl|neledh]] [[neledhi]] '''gar''' [[godrebh]]''"<ref name=AI>{{HM|AI}}, pp. 92, 150 (note 6)</ref>
#in an Elvish poem published in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics]]'': "[...] ''Damrod dir hanach dalath benn '''gar''' meilien'' [...]"<ref>{{MC|Secret}}, p. 217</ref>

David Kiltz has suggested that ''gar'' likely means "to go", or something similar.<ref>David Kiltz, [https://tolkienlistsearch.herokuapp.com/message/5e9c3603acad32fd587a382b Noldorin _gar_ (message 512)] (dated 30 October 2003) at [[Elfling]]</ref> [[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull|Scull]] also appear to translate ''gar'' as "go" in their translation of the phrase on the draft of Thrór's Map.<ref name=AI/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the earlier [[Gnomish]], ''gar'' means "place, district".<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entry "Dor Faidwen"</ref>
